results.name: Number of permutations of length n with 1 fixed and 1 reflected point.
comment: Number of distinct solutions to the order n checkerboard problem, including symmetrical solutions: place n pieces on an n X n board so there is exactly one piece in each row, column and main diagonal. Compare A064280.
Number of magic permutation matrices of order n. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Jan 15 2019
Upper bound for the number of diagonal transversals in a Latin square: A287647(n) <= A287648(n) <= a(n). - _Eduard I. Vatutin_, Jan 02 2020
reference: Simpson, Todd; Permutations with unique fixed and reflected points. Ars Combin. 39 (1995), 97-108.
